meta.description: Get the collaborators list and details

contract_api_name.text: The name of the contract API

user.text: Represents the list of collaborators to be added to the contract where each item contains the details of each collaborator

id.text: Represents the unique ID of the collaborator.

permissions.text: Represents the collaborator's permission in the contract document. ( 7-Write, 11-Comment and Fill Fields, 9-Fill Fields Only, 3-Comment Only, 1-View Only)

message.text: Represents the message to be included in the notification email sent to the collaborator

notify.text: Represents whether to send an email notification upon addition

name.text: Represents the name of the contract type

description.text: Represents the description of the contract type

intent.text: Represents the status of the contract type. Values : (0-Others, 1-Buy, 2-Sell)

partyA.text: Represents the contracting party in a contract.  Values : (0-My Company, 1-Counterparty)

partyB.text: Represents the contracting party in a contract. Values : (0-My Company, 1-Counterparty)

isCustom.text: Represents whether the contract type is custom build.

categories.text: Represents the category of the contract type.

approvalWorkflow.text: Represents the approval workflow assigned to the contract type.

state.text: Represents the working status of the contract type template. Values : (0-Disabled, 1-Enabled)

meta.description: Get the details of a contract

source.text: Represents the origin of the contract

inputfields.text: Represents all the fields used to create the contract

metaApiName.text: Represents the API name of the field used to create a contract. The field can be a particular field or a field and its related fields

inputs.text: The array represents the API names of the fields and its value used to create a contract

inputApiName.text: Represents the API name of the field used to create a contract. Refer to the inputApiNames List below that lists all the values of the inputApiName key

inputValue.text: Represents the value of a field used to create a contract. Regarding the data type, refer to the data type of each of the inputApiNames' values in the inputApiNames List below

clauseOverrides.text: Represents the array of default clauses to deselect and the alternative languages of the selected clauses with their selection or deselection status

apiName.text: Represents the API name of a clause or a clause's alternative language

alternatives.text: Represents the array of the alternative languages of a clause where each item contains their API name and the selection or deselection status

action.text: Represents the selection status of the clause to deselect and the alternative languages of a selected clause to select or deselect. Values : (0-Deselect, 1-Select)

api_name.text: The name of the obligation in the API
The name of the obligation in the API

meta.description: Get the list of obligations

contract_api_name.text: The name of the contract API

name.text: Represents the name of the obligation

category.text: Represents the category the obligation falls under

priority.text: Represents the priority of the obligation. Values : (0-Low, 1-Medium, 2-High)

hasTask.text: Represents whether the obligation is a task or not

taskOwners.text: Represents the ID of the obligation's owner

recurring.text: Represents whether the obligation task is of a recurring type

startsOn.text: Represents whether the start date of the recurring obligation's first instance is on a specific date or on the contract effective date. Values : (1-Specific Date, 2-On Effective Date)

startDate.text: Represents the start date in javascript milliseconds format

dueOnTermination.text: Represents whether the recurring obligation ends with contract expiry or termination

timePeriod.text: Represents whether the obligation's recurring task instance's due is by days, week, month, or year. Values : (0-Days, 1-Weeks, 2-Months, 3-Years)

frequency.text: Represents whether the obligation's recurring task instance's due is by N days, weeks, months, or years based on the given timePeriod

days.text: Represents the day in which the recurring task has to be repeated when timePeriod is days

weeks.text: Represents the day of the week in which the recurring task has to be repeated when timePeriod is weeks. It applies only when the frequency value is 2 and above. Values : (0 to 6-Sunday to Monday, 7-First Day, 8-Last Day)

months.text: Represents the day of the month in which the recurring task has to be repeated when timePeriod is months. It applies only when the frequency value is 2 and above. Values : (0 to 6-Sunday to Monday, 7-First Day, 8-Second Day, 9-Third Day, 10-Fourth Day, 11-Last, 1 to 28-1st to 28th, 29-Last Day, 30-One day before the last day, 31-Two days before the last day)

years.text: Represents the day/month of the year in which the recurring task has to be repeated when timePeriod is years. It applies only when the frequency value is 2 and above. Values : (0 to 6-Sunday to Monday, 7-First Day, 8-Second Day, 9-Third Day, 10-Fourth Day, 11-Last, 1 to 28-1st to 28th, 29-Last Day, 30-One day before the last day, 31-Two days before the last day, 0 to 11-January to December)

startDate.text: Represents the start date in javascript milliseconds format
